content.description: This is a great intro problem for bouldering or highballing. Start on a good left hold and one good jib. Move up and slightly right to a good rail. Get on the rail and move to a smaller rail of crimps. Top out.
content.protection: Several pads depending on how comfortable you are.
content.location: The downclimb is a great question. I climbed down the route and jumped. There's another place around the corner to make an 8 foot jump down, but the landing is a tad more questionable.

content.description:
This is a strange problem. The landing isn't good, which is why I assume there's one bolt 11 feet up. That being said, you could "top rope" it, even though you'll top out above the bolt.

Start on a big boulder on the ground and head upward using slopers and crimps. Topping out is the crux.
content.location:
Good luck finding a downclimb. You can jump from the bolt onto the boulder below or downclimb

Sissy's Revenge

around the corner.
